title: General Equation of a Plane Quiz
description: Test your understanding of general equations of planes.

questions.question: What is the general equation of a plane?
questions.explanation: The general equation is ax + by + cz + d = 0.

questions.question: In ax + by + cz + d = 0, what do a, b, c represent?
questions.explanation: a, b, c are the components of the normal vector to the plane.

questions.question: The distance from origin to plane ax + by + cz + d = 0 is:
questions.explanation: Distance = |d| / √(a² + b² + c²), where the normal vector has magnitude √(a² + b² + c²).

questions.question: A plane parallel to the xy-plane has equation:
questions.explanation: Parallel to xy-plane means normal vector (0,0,1), so equation is z = constant.

questions.question: The intercept form represents a plane that:
options: Cuts coordinate axes at given points
questions.explanation: The intercept form x/a + y/b + z/c = 1 shows intercepts a, b, c on the axes.
